etymologies: 1930s; earliest use found in American Mineralogist. From German Milarit from the name of Val Milar, a valley in the Swiss Alps + -it

definitions: A hexagonal silicate, K₂ Ca₄ Al₂ Be₄ Si₂₄ O₆₀ ·H₂ O, that occurs especially in pegmatites as colourless to pale green prismatic crystals and fibrous aggregates.
